title: Re: A yorp in Duke Nukem Gameboy Color?
content:
Thats because you linked directly to one of their images; pretty quickly the server realizes that people like us are looking at their pictures without looking at their site [and thus buying their stuff]

The only honest thing to do is steal that image ileagaly and post it here:

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/yourp.png[/img]A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

title: Arg.
content:
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-shikadi.gif[/img] Double crime! A complete GBC mockery of yet another quality game and the yorp anatomy in one go!

Well, it's entirely possible I'm wrong about the game being dodgy. I didn't even know there was a Duke game for GBC until now. Judging from the ugly attempt at making the scenery look "realistic", I'm willing to throw caution to the wind and generalise remakes of Apogee/id games as OMGWTF.

Weeeeeeb! *shrugs* Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

A concerned member of the Preservation of Endangered Spleens Society

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/]JimSoft Lair[/url]

title: Re: A yorp in Duke Nukem Gameboy Color?
content:
Ah... just because LL didn't beat my to it:

The breed of Yorp you are looking at is known as Yorphus negatus-najiwha (Some translate it as Yorp minus Najawa [because they have no mouth, and cannot type for their life]). It was a breed formed by mort himself, who loved the slave labor yorps could perform, but mort, unlike most humans, was gifted with the ability to hear higher pitched sounds. He thus genetically made them without a mouth, and thus they would feed off of evil!

They soon inhereted the red eye, and long legs from slave labor.

LL can improve opon this if she pleases.Tough Guys Wear Pink!!!
[img]http://i15.photobucket.com/albums/a371/najawa/Modding/tough_guys_wear_pink.jpg[/img]
Visit My site at [url=http://www.najawa.com]www.najawa.com[/url]
[url=http://kevan.org/brain.cgi?Najawa]Click Here!!! Please!!![/url]
-- NAJAWA --
